sourceMeaningMnemonic: In a <radical>tree</radical> on <radical>nine</radical> branches are some <radical>cross</radical> <kanji>frame</kanji>s. Each cross frame is hung on the branches of the tree. You don’t know who decided to hang the frames there, but you think it might be some new wave art or something. Actually you need a frame, and there are already nine up there, so you decide to take one.
meaningInfo: Feel the tree bark under your palms as you climb up the tree to take a frame. You get a splinter from grabbing the frame. It really smarts.
readingMnemonic: You realize that the <kanji>frame</kanji> isn't half as nice as you thought it was, in fact it's totally <reading>wack</reading> (<ja>わく</ja>). How disappointing.
readingInfo: Why is this frame so wack? Think about what makes it wack, to help you remember this reading.
